description: UMD 2.2.0 is the second update of UMD-2 (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release provides product updates from Technology Providers, as well as two new products.
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><div><b>EMI Technology Provider:</b></div><div><b>Parallel Job:</b></div><div>MPI 1.3.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>First release in SL6<br></li><li>MPD startup of MPICH2 jobs enabled in non-shared home directory WN (bug #49)<br></li><li>MPICH2 with hydra tested with Torque/PBS and SGE (bug #51)<br></li><li>General improvement of documentation.</li></ul></div><div><b>Authorization services:</b></div><div>ARGUS 1.5.9 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>First release in SL6<br></li><li>Argus 1.5 publish its GLUE2 information to BDII<br></li><li>New Nagios probes available to monitor Argus 1.5<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre; ">	</span></li></ul></div><div><b>Job Execution services:</b></div><div>CREAM SGE module 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>First release in SL6<br></li><li>Glue2 support in the dynamic provider</li></ul></div><div>LB 3.2.7 (contains features and bug fixes from 3.2.6) released for SL5:</div><div><ul><li>L&amp;B 3.2 implements extended messaging capabilities (job history, anonymization), server-side statistics,&nbsp;</li><li>finalized CREAM support, and provides&nbsp;fixes for multiple bugs identified in various stages of the product's life cycle.&nbsp;</li><li>Documentation was updated to reflect the changes.</li><li>Fixes for occasional notification interlogger crashes and problems with dumping and loading L&amp;B events.</li></ul></div><div><b>Attribute Authority services:</b></div><div>UNICORE UVOS 1.5.1 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian squeeze:</div><div><ul><li>First release in SL6 and Debian squeeze<br></li><li>Bug in UVOS server was fixed, which resulted in extensive logging under server's heavy load</li></ul></div><div><b>Credential Management services:</b></div><div>EMI-MyPROXY 1.0.1, IGE Globus MyPROXY 5.6.3 and gLite-proxyrenewal 1.3.25 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>First release in SL6<br></li><li>EMI MyPROXY uses IGE MyPROXY 5.6.3, it adds the yaim configuration and BDII for resource information publication.&nbsp;<br></li><li>Bugfix release for the previous version of ProxyRenewal, fixing problems with VOMS attributes and anonymous MyProxy connections.</li></ul></div><div><b>Information Discovery and Information Model:</b></div><div>BDII core 1.4.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Affects BDII site, BDII top and all services with BDII as resource information provider.<br></li><li>A new cron job is run every hour to execute the glue-validator script and validate the information published by the BDII against glue 1.3 and glue 2.0 schema. The results are logged in:<br></li><ul><li>/var/log/glue-validator/glue1-validator.log</li><li>/var/log/glue-validator/glue2-validator.log</li></ul><li>IPv6 support included with the new yaim variable BDII_IPV6_SUPPORT, which is set to "no" by default. If set to "yes";, it enables both IPv4 and IPv6 support.<br></li><li>Fixed GLUE 2 bugs in the service information provider affecting VOMS and MyProxy, and improved the README files.<br></li><li>glite-yaim-bdii cleaning removing old variables and functions. Fixed minor errors printed at configuration time (this affected only the top level BDII).<br></li><li>emi-resource-information-service metapackage now depends on glite-yaim-bdii and glue-validaror-cron.<br></li><li>Improved description and summary of glue-schema rpm.</li></ul></div><div><b>Authentication:</b></div><div>gridsite 1.7.22 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Affects CREAM and WN<br></li><li>Bugfix release for GridSite, addressing mod_gridsite failure on access from machines with no reverse DNS records.</li></ul></div><div>Trustmanager 3.1.4 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Affects VOMS, ARGUS<br></li><li>Fix for bug - "Trustmanager fails to read private keys that have text before the private key data"</li></ul></div><div><b>Client API and Tools:</b></div><div>- GFAL/lcg_utils 1.13.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Affects UI and WN<br></li><li>This is a 32/64 bit build of LCG_Util 1.13.0<br></li><li>gfal2 first stable release, include support for:<br></li><ul><li>gfal 2.0 file transfer API</li><li>gfal 2.0 gridftp plugin</li><li>gfal 2.0 python bindings</li><li>gfal 2.0 File system ( gfalFS, fuse tool )<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre; ">	</span></li></ul></ul></div><div><b>IGE Technology Provider:</b></div><div><b>Security services:</b></div><div>Globus default security 5.2.1 released in SL5:</div><div><ul><li>Release notes: http://globus.org.eu/toolkit/docs/5.2/5.2.1/gsic/rn/</li></ul></div><div><b>Authorization services:</b></div><div>Security integration 2.2.0 released in SL5:</div><div><ul><li>Globus Toolkit and SCAS client backends for LCAS/LCMAPS<br></li></ul></div>
installationNotes: <div>This is the second update of the UMD-2 that is made available for EGI's production infrastructure. &nbsp;All products in the UMD 2.2.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria&nbsp;(for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze).</div><br/><div>Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository: <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_2/">http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_2/</a>.</div>
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="http://ggus.eu">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report
knownIssues: Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in: <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.2.0">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.2.0</a>
changeLog: <div>This release introduces the following new products into the UMD2 distribution:</div><div><ul><li>MPI 1.3.0</li><li>ARGUS 1.5.9,&nbsp;</li><li>CREAM-SGE module 2.0.0</li><li>UNICORE UVOS 1.5.1</li><li>EMI MyPROXY 1.0.1 (includes Globus MyPROXY 5.6.3)</li><li>LB 3.2.7,&nbsp;</li><li>IGE Globus default security 5.2.1</li><li>IGE security integration 2.2.0.</li></ul></div><div>This release contains updates of the following components:</div><div><ul><li>- BDII core 1.4.0</li><li>Gridsite 1.7.22</li><li>Trustmanager 3.1.4</li><li>GFAL/lcg_utils 1.13.0<br></li></ul></div>

products.name: emi.argus
products.description: Argus is a system meant to render consistent authorization decisions for distributed services (e.g. compute elements, portals). In order to achieve this consistency a number of points must be addressed. First, it must be possible to author and maintain consistent authorization policies. This is handled by the Policy Administration Point (PAP) component in the service. Second, authored policies must be evaluated in a consistent manner, a task performed by the Policy Decision Point (PDP). Finally, the data provided for evaluation against policies must be consistent (in form and definition) and this is done by the Policy Enforcement Point (PEP).

products.name: emi.bdii-core
products.description: Grid information systems are mission-critical components in today's production grid infrastructures. They provide detailed information about grid services which is needed for various different tasks. The EMI information system has a hierarchical structure of three levels. The fundamental building block used in this hierarchy is the Berkley Database Information Index (BDII). Although the BDII has additional complexity, it can be visualized as an LDAP database. The resource level BDII is usually co-located with the grid service and provides information about that service. Each grid site runs a site level BDII. This aggregates the information from all the resource level BDIIs running at that site. The top level BDII aggregates all the information from all the site level BDIIs and hence contains information about all grid services. There are multiple instances of the top level BDII in order to provide a fault tolerant, load balanced service. The information system clients query a top level BDII to find the information that they require.
products.releaseNotes:
A new cron job is run every hour to execute the glue-validator script and validate the information published by the BDII against glue 1.3 and glue 2.0 schema. The results are logged in:

        /var/log/glue-validator/glue1-validator.log

        /var/log/glue-validator/glue2-validator.log

    IPv6 support included with the new yaim variable BDII_IPV6_SUPPORT, which is set to "no" by default. If set to "yes";, it enables both IPv4 and IPv6 support.

    Fixed GLUE 2 bugs in the service information provider affecting VOMS and MyProxy, and improved the README files.

    glite-yaim-bdii cleaning removing old variables and functions. Fixed minor errors printed at configuration time (this affected only the top level BDII).

    emi-resource-information-service metapackage now depends on glite-yaim-bdii and glue-validaror-cron.

    Improved description and summary of glue-validator rpm.
products.changeLog:
A new cron job is run every hour to execute the glue-validator script and validate the information published by the BDII against glue 1.3 and glue 2.0 schema. The results are logged in:

        /var/log/glue-validator/glue1-validator.log

        /var/log/glue-validator/glue2-validator.log

    IPv6 support included with the new yaim variable BDII_IPV6_SUPPORT, which is set to "no" by default. If set to "yes";, it enables both IPv4 and IPv6 support.

    Fixed GLUE 2 bugs in the service information provider affecting VOMS and MyProxy, and improved the README files.

    glite-yaim-bdii cleaning removing old variables and functions. Fixed minor errors printed at configuration time (this affected only the top level BDII).

    emi-resource-information-service metapackage now depends on glite-yaim-bdii and glue-validaror-cron.

    Improved description and summary of glue-validator rpm.

products.name: emi.gfal-lcg_util
products.description:
GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

The version 2.0 of GFAL tries to simplify at the maximum the file operations in a distributed environment.

the complexity of the grid is hidden from the client side behind a simple common POSIX API.

GFAL 2.0 is able to manage all the common used file access protocols in a grid environment  Dcap GSIDCAP, LFN RFIO (  DPM or CASTOR )  SRM,  GridFTP,  HTTP/WebDav .
products.releaseNotes:
This is a 32/64 bit build of LCG_Util 1.13.0 - see the complete Release Notes for more details



    gfal2 first stable release

        include support for :

            gfal 2.0 file transfer API

            gfal 2.0 gridftp plugin

    gfal 2.0 python bindings

    gfal 2.0 File system ( gfalFS, fuse tool )
products.changeLog:
This is a 32/64 bit build of LCG_Util 1.13.0 - see the complete Release Notes for more details



    gfal2 first stable release

        include support for :

            gfal 2.0 file transfer API

            gfal 2.0 gridftp plugin

    gfal 2.0 python bindings

    gfal 2.0 File system ( gfalFS, fuse tool )

products.name: emi.gridsite
products.description:
The Module Architecture implemented by GridSite extends Apache by adding extra components at the

access control and HTTP method execution layers, and supports CGI services supplied with GridSite or

written by third parties.

mod_gridsite is a loadable module for the Apache web server which provides access control and page

formatting for GridSite HTTP(S) Fileservers, Websites and Web Services hosts. mod_gridsite also intercepts

some processing in the standard mod_ssl module to support GSI Proxies and VOMS attribute

certificates, as well as the normal X.509 client certificates. The verification of these credentials is handled

by functions within mod_gridsite and the main GridSite shared library, without the need to patch or rebuild

mod_ssl.
products.releaseNotes: This is a bugfix release for GridSite, addressing mod_gridsite failure on access from machines with no reverse DNS records.
products.changeLog: This is a bugfix release for GridSite, addressing mod_gridsite failure on access from machines with no reverse DNS records.

products.name: emi.lb
products.description:
The Logging and Bookkeeping service (LB for short) was initially developed in the EU DataGrid project1

as a part of the Workload Management System (WMS). The development continued in the EGEE, EGEEII

and EGEE-III projects,2 where LB became an independent part of the gLite3 middleware [1], and then

in the EMI Project
products.releaseNotes: This is a bugfix release of LB 3.2, providing fixes for occasional notification interlogger crashes and problems with dumping and loading LB events. A few minor bugs have also been fixed and documentation was updated to reflect LB's release status and several new tests.
products.changeLog: This is a bugfix release of LB 3.2, providing fixes for occasional notification interlogger crashes and problems with dumping and loading LB events. A few minor bugs have also been fixed and documentation was updated to reflect LB's release status and several new tests.

products.name: emi.trustmanager
products.description: TrustManager is an implementation of the java TrustManager interface with implementation of cert path checking, grid namespace restrictions and dynamic loading of CA certs, credentials, CRLs and namespace restrictions. Also provided is integration into tomcat, axis and axis2. There are many utility classes and methods for certificate and proxy creation and handling in trustmanager. It can be used both in the server side for the server ssl handler and on the client side for the opening of ssl connections.
products.releaseNotes: fix for bug #94300 - "Trustmanager fails to read private keys that have text before the private key data"
products.changeLog: fix for bug #94300 - "Trustmanager fails to read private keys that have text before the private key data"
